column4: Hi People! I want to install an application that needs libjpg8. Anybody an idea how i get that?
is it libjpg or libjpeg (if it's libjpeg, then "sudo apt-get install libjpeg8")
which version of ubuntu are you using ?
you may want to try enabling the backports repositories
ok. how do i do that?
hmm... ok, i copied the first line in my sources.list and changed "lucid" to "lucid-backports". lets see what happens now...
then I guess if you really need if it, you'll have to compile it yourself (there doesn't seem to be any ppa for that package for lucid)
apt-cache search libjpeg finds libjpeg62. should i use that?
if you application is saying it requires libjpeg8 I don't think that would work
so how do i compile it?
download the source for maverick for example (https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/maverick/+source/libjpeg8/8a-1)
